devdoc.details: The AddressDictator (glory to Arstotzka) is a contract that allows us to safely manipulate      many different addresses in the AddressManager without transferring ownership of the      AddressManager to a hot wallet or hardware wallet.

params._addresses: Array of addresses to associate with the name.
params._finalOwner: Address to transfer AddressManager ownership to afterwards.
params._names: Array of names to associate an address with.

devdoc.title: AddressDictator

returnOwnership().notice: Transfers ownership of this contract to the finalOwner. Only callable by the Final Owner, which is intended to be our multisig. This function shouldn't be necessary, but it gives a sense of reassurance that we can recover if something really surprising goes wrong.

setAddresses().notice: Called to finalize the transfer, this function is callable by anyone, but will only result in an upgrade if this contract is the owner Address Manager.
